body: @ivandeex did you add "OS: Windows" label by mistake (and on #5784 too)?

issue.title: backend/cache test failure on linux/386

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

**STOP and READ**
**YOUR POST WILL BE REMOVED IF IT IS LOW QUALITY**:
Please show the effort you've put in to solving the problem and please be specific.
People are volunteering their time to help! Low effort posts are not likely to get good answers!

If you think you might have found a bug, try to replicate it with the latest beta (or stable).
The update instructions are available at https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_selfupdate/

If you can still replicate it or just got a question then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

for a quick response instead of filing an issue on this repo.

If nothing else helps, then please fill in the info below which helps us help you.

**DO NOT REDACT** any information except passwords/keys/personal info.

You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.

Make sure to include a log obtained with '-vv'.

You can also use '-vv --log-file bug.log' and a service such as https://pastebin.com or https://gist.github.com/

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

The test for `backend/cache` fails since 09fd258b5c1c52a9515cf09f6cf088af5a463a6f (according to `git bisect`).

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits

Void Linux i686, go1.17.2
Alpine 3.14 i386 (container), go1.16.8

#### The command you were trying to run

```
$ git checkout 454574e2cc974a3cacff6ea48e3eeb899d592ec5
$ RCLONE_CONFIG="/notfound" go test -v ./backend/cache
```
Log is attached because it contains binary data.
[log_backend_cache.txt](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/7471921/log_backend_cache.txt)


<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the ðŸ‘ [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.

body:
> @4ricci can you try increasing this number
> 
> https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/25366268fe921608ee68c6dc33b744b80d860abe/backend/ftp/ftp_internal_test.go#L39
> 
> and see if you can get the tests to pass?

Yes, setting it to 10 seconds makes the test pass.

issue.title: rclone: update to 1.57.0

body:
> > @4ricci can you try increasing this number
> > https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/25366268fe921608ee68c6dc33b744b80d860abe/backend/ftp/ftp_internal_test.go#L39
> > 
> > and see if you can get the tests to pass?
> 
> Yes, setting it to 10 seconds makes the test pass.

Great!

Do you want to send a Pull request with that fix in?

issue.title: backend/ftp: increase testUploadTimeout.maxTime to 10 seconds

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
On slow machines (e.g. Github CI), especially if GOARCH=386,
the test for cmd/serve/ftp could fail if this value is too small.

Fixes #5783


#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [ ] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)
